info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 27 at 5:52PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Mercer, northwestern Burlington and southeastern Bucks Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 552 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Willingboro, or 13 miles northeast of Camden, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Willingboro, Lumberton, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Mount Holly, Riverside, Bordentown, Beverly, Tullytown, Pemberton, Wrightstown, Florence-Roebling, Jacksonville, Georgetown, Andalusia, Levittown, Jobstown and Columbus. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike between exits 5 and 7A. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 356 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 34 and 40. Interstate 195 in New Jersey near mile marker 0. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 40 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
